comments.author: Fahad Ali
comments.content: I love this Place.I wish I will be there with Khalid & other Friends of Off Road Club Karachi in This season.As Wild life (crocodiles & Ibex) are the most attractive portion of the tour.And off course four wheeling Passion of the Jeepers will be there.I have seen this sight (Hingol) so many times now I feel I m in love with Hingol river.I love nature,adventure & Four wheeling.If all comes in one tour “Nothing Like IT”.

comments.author: KO
comments.content:
GPS location for Hingol:

25 41’ 09.39” N

65 32’ 09.27” E

Download Google Earth and you can see the Makran Coastal Higway going to Hingol.

comments.author: Umair Ahmed Shaikh
comments.content: I went with my office colleagues to Hinglaj valley and it was a wonderful experience. The terrain is beautiful and it kept changing from plains to mountains to desert to virgin sea belt throughout the coastal highway. Its a worth-see place for a person who enjoys the nature. I will be writing in detail about it. The pics have been uploaded at http://community.webshots.com/user/umasha79

comments.author: Naveed Shahzad
comments.content: Visited Hangol National Park, Nani Mandir, Kund Malir and Buzi Pass on December 02, 2006. For those of you who do not have 4WD vehicles, these areas are easily accessible even on saloon cars and believe me, these are a must visit areas if you are an adventure lover without the luxury of a 4WD. Just a simple advice, keep an eye open for the flash floods especially during raining season when in Hanglaj valley. Road to Nani Mandir is breath taking, just take the Makran Coastal Highway off RCD highway at zero point and take a right turn just before Hangol River Bridge and you just cannot miss the Nani Mandir.
